questions.question_text:
View the Exhibit and examine the structure of the EMP table.
//IMG//

You want to create two procedures using the overloading feature to search for employee details based on either the employee name or employee number.
Which two rules should you apply to ensure that the overloading feature is used successfully? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Yes, the correct answer is BE. 
Explanation : This is called PROCEDURE OVERLOADING. Which means procedure with same name and different SIGNATURES.
Procedure/Functions with same name are only allowed inside a package and not stand alone. As in the stand alone, you will have name conflicts when you see them in the list.
Also, when we say signature should be different it means input/output variable name can be same but their datatype should be different.
e.g. proc A( x number, y number)
proc A ( x varchar2, y varchar2)
is an example of procedure overloading
Signature - Parameter Mode (IN, OUT, INOUT), Datatype (char, date etc.), Number, Return Clause. Parameter name would be same

choices.B: The procedures should be created only as packaged subprograms.
choices.A: The procedures can be either stand-alone or packaged.
choices.C: The procedures should be created only as stand-alone subprograms.
choices.E: The formal parameters of each subprogram should differ in data type but can use the same names.
choices.D: Each subprogram's formal parameters should differ in both name and data type.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the instead of triggers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Correct answer is C and D

comments.content:
C and D are correct.
Not all views require an instead of trigger to be updated so B is wrong (https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/appdev.111/b28370/triggers.htm#i1025919).
For D, see https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/appdev.111/b28370/triggers.htm#LNPLS20041

discussion.content:
should be B and C, check option is a constraint on a view but permits to add a valid data 
instead of clause is used with triggers for views on wich you cant make any DML operations on it

choices.A: Delete operations cannot be performed using the instead of triggers.
choices.C: The instead of triggers can be written only for views, and the before and after timing options are not valid.
choices.B: The instead or triggers must be created to add or modify data through any view.
choices.D: The check option for views is not enforced when Insertions or updates to the view are performed by using the instead of triggers.
Functions having in, out, or in out parameters can be called in PL/SQL procedures and anonymous blocks.
choices.C: Functions having in, out, or in out parameters can be called only in named PL/SQL subprograms
choices.B: Functions called in SQL statements cannot have out or in out mode parameters.
choices.A: Functions can have only in mode parameters.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are correct about the usage of parameters in functions? (Choose two.)

choices.C: It gives an error because the AVG function cannot be used in a PL/SQL block
choices.B: It gives an error because decode cannot be used in a PL/SQL block.
choices.D: It gives an error because the MONTHS_BETWEEN function cannot be used in a PL/SQL block.
choices.E: It gives an error because both the AVG and decode functions cannot be used in a PL/SQL block.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
a IS CORRECT
A is correct. Syntax-wise it will execute, During runtime it may fail due to lack of exception handling, incase value is not found.

choices.B: It can be used in both a parallelized query and a parallelized DML statement.
choices.D: It can have a separate copy run in each of the multiple processes when called from a SQL statement that is run in parallel.
choices.A: It can be used only in a parallelized query.
choices.E: It requires a PRAGMA RESTRICT_REFERENCES declaration with RNDS, WNDS, RNPS, and WNPS specified in order to use parallel optimization.
choices.C: It can be used only in a parallelized data manipulation language (DML) statement.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
BD IS THE RIGHT ANSWER

B and D are correct answers. Read documentation bellow to understand why E is not a correct one.

https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/appdev.111/b28370/restrictreferences_pragma.htm#LNPLS01339
